revised_title: A Study of Ciliated Grooves in the Brain of the Ammocete and Their Role in Circulation
tldr: The author investigates the function of ciliated grooves in the brain of the Ammocete, a type of lamprey, and suggests that they play a role in promoting the circulation of fluid within the brain cavity. The study also discusses the evolutionary implications of these structures and their potential connection to the development of the vertebrate nervous system.
